channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Six in 10 Singaporeans satisfied with Govt's management of Covid-19 situation: Survey
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:36 PM

SINGAPORE - A recent survey on workplace resilience has found that close to six in 10 Singaporeans were satisfied with how the Government managed the Covid-19 situation, though they may feel stressed by the pandemic.

item.title: Company fined $52,000 for inflating monthly salaries of foreign workers in S Pass applications
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:24 PM

SINGAPORE - To secure work passes for its foreign employees, a company inflated their monthly salaries in its applications to the Ministry of Manpower (MOM).

item.title: SIA cabin crew trainers to train patient care officers at Khoo Teck Puat Hospital
item.description:
August 20, 2020 4:41 PM

SINGAPORE - Patients at the Khoo Teck Puat Hospital will soon be able to get a taste of the Singapore Airlines (SIA) service, with the carrier's cabin crew trainers set to train a new group of staff there from next month.

item.title: 68 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 2 imported; no community cases
item.description:
August 20, 2020 3:54 PM

The two imported cases had been placed on stay-home notices upon arrival in Singapore.

item.title: SMC: Interim orders against 2 doctors accused of preying on vulnerable patients needed to maintain public trust
item.description:
August 20, 2020 3:47 PM

SINGAPORE - Public confidence in the medical profession would have been dampened if no restrictions were placed on two doctors accused by a woman of taking advantage of vulnerable patients for sex, the Singapore Medical Council (SMC) said.

item.title: SP Group to invest $30 million in research and education initiatives with NTU
item.description:
August 20, 2020 3:27 PM

SINGAPORE - National power grid operator SP Group has set aside $20 million to launch a joint lab with Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and contributed $10 million towards setting up two endowment funds with the university.

item.title: Discrimination has no place in Singapore society: President Halimah
item.description:
August 20, 2020 3:24 PM

In strong terms, President Halimah Yacob has made clear there is no place for discrimination of any form and against anyone in Singapore.

item.title: Grandfather's stories of being beat cop in 1960s inspire Home Team scholarship recipient
item.description:
August 20, 2020 3:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Mr Jared Koh grew up listening to his grandfather's police yarns, including his time as a beat cop in Singapore's founding years.

item.title: Singaporeans affected by Covid-19 get employment help at Nee Soon job fair
item.description:
August 20, 2020 2:40 PM

SINGAPORE - While some companies are laying off staff or have stopped hiring due to the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, there are other firms that need staff.

item.title: Fishing community proposes three sustainable fishing guidelines amid local fishing boom
item.description:
August 20, 2020 2:37 PM

SINGAPORE - With travel off the cards, anglers in Singapore are casting their lines into local waters more often, raising the question of whether seafood could be fished out faster than they can reproduce.

item.title: Big drama in Little India as four men bundle Ferrari driver into another car and speed off
item.description:
August 20, 2020 1:00 PM

The four men were arrested on Monday (Aug 17) for their role in an apparent abduction.

item.title: NCSS to hire up to 50 executives to manage volunteers at social service agencies here
item.description:
August 20, 2020 12:30 PM

SINGAPORE - The National Council of Social Service (NCSS) is looking to hire up to 50 professionals, managers or executives from outside the social service sector to manage volunteers at charities here.

item.title: Hotpot billionaire couple Zhang Yong, Shu Ping top Forbes list of Singapore's richest
item.description:
August 20, 2020 11:39 AM

Haidilao co-founders, Zhang Yong and his wife Shu Ping, lead the pack with a combined net worth of US$19 billion.

item.title: More than 4,600 vacancies offered by start-ups, top 5 job roles pay $2,700 to $6,000 a month: MOM
item.description:
August 20, 2020 11:30 AM

The top jobs offered are software developers, chefs, engineering professionals, managers in sales, among others.

item.title: Boon Tat Street death: Man convicted of culpable homicide for stabbing son-in-law
item.description:
August 20, 2020 11:28 AM

The 72-year-old was unhappy with how his son-in-law had treated his daughter and believed that the victim planned to cheat him of his business.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 20
Experts fear long-term effect on mental health
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The prolonged Covid-19 pandemic is likely to have a long-term effect on mental health, as stress levels rise with the uncertainty of the outbreak as well as the economic downturn it brings, experts have warned.

item.title: Aviation and aerospace firms continue to manage costs as Covid-19 pandemic rages on
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

But with a full recovery for air travel nowhere in sight, companies are looking to adapt, diversify and innovate.

item.title: Some driven to breaking point by stress during Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The pandemic has not only worsened the mental health of some people, but also caused increased stress in others who do not have existing mental health issues.

item.title: Car COE prices end at their highest in more than a year
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Certificate of entitlement (COE) premiums ended mostly higher at the latest tender yesterday as pent-up demand continued to exert pressure.

item.title: All migrant worker dorms declared clear of Covid-19
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

All dormitories were declared to be clear of Covid-19 as of yesterday, including the standalone blocks in purpose-built dormitories that served as isolation or quarantine facilities.

item.title: Two people killed in accident on Tampines Expressway
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A man and a woman were killed in an accident involving a car and a motorcycle on Tampines Expressway (TPE) towards Seletar Expressway on Tuesday evening.

item.title: 7-year-old girl among six imported Covid-19 cases
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

There were 93 new coronavirus cases confirmed yesterday, taking Singapore's total to 56,031.

item.title: Two S'poreans jailed for arranging sham marriage
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Two Singaporean men have been jailed for arranging a marriage of convenience between a Singaporean man and a female Chinese national.

item.title: Nearly threefold rise in number of households getting help from HDB
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 1,356 households who could not meet their monthly mortgage payments received help from the Housing Board (HDB) from April to June this year, as Singaporeans grappled with the economic impact of the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: JC grads give seed kits to seniors amid Covid-19
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

After receiving their A-level results earlier this year, Ms Maxine Cassandra Lau and Ms Grace Shani Anthony had no idea what to do next.

item.title: Of scents and charity
Six months' jail for maid who abused intellectually disabled boy
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A domestic helper, who was left to take care of an intellectually disabled boy at home, ill-treated him by kicking him multiple times.

item.title: Northern coastal areas to form second nature park network
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 400ha of wetlands, marshes, nature parks and eco-corridors along the northern coast, which include Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, the Kranji Marshes and the upcoming Mandai Mangrove and Mudflat Nature Park, have collectively become Singapore's second nature park network.

item.title: Diversity of charity boards has impact on performance: Study
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A study of the management boards of charities has found that greater diversity of board members shows better financial performance for the charity.

item.title: November trade show on franchising to go virtual
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

An annual trade event for people in the franchise business will go virtual this year, with an online "exhibition hall" and vendor stands that they can visit with a click of the mouse.

item.title: More flat owners get help with mortgages
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Nearly three times as many households received help with mortgage payments from April to June this year than in the same period last year, the Housing Board told The Straits Times yesterday.

item.title: Muslim charity, Red Cross raise $152k for Beirut blast relief
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A local Muslim charity foundation and the Singapore Red Cross have raised $152,530 for victims of the recent massive explosion in Beirut, the Lebanese capital.

item.title: Sungei Buloh Nature Park Network
More than 40 govt e-services available on rebranded app
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A government smartphone app that provides services to users at various stages of their lives has been upgraded to give them access to more than 40 government services.

item.title: President's Challenge 2021 to focus on digital inclusion of the vulnerable
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Ensuring digital inclusion of vulnerable groups in society will be the theme for next year's President's Challenge, an annual fund-raiser for the less fortunate.

item.title: China's top diplomat in Singapore on visit
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

China's top diplomat is on a visit to Singapore and South Korea in what could be viewed as a bid by the nation to strengthen ties with its Asian neighbours amid deteriorating relations with the United States.

item.title: Certis promotes inclusivity by hiring two people with disabilities
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Under a new initiative promoting inclusivity in the workplace and society, security services provider Certis has hired two people with disabilities as call centre operators.

item.title: More working from home feel stressed than those on Covid-19 front line
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

IT project manager Valerie Lim, 45, is very relieved that Singapore is now in phase two of its reopening as her two children, aged five and 11, are back in school.

item.title: 8 months' jail for former delivery driver who pocketed cash, phones
item.description:
August 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A former Ninja Van delivery driver, who was in debt to loan sharks, pocketed over $18,000 in cash that he had collected for the company.

item.title: Coronavirus trial: Grab driver refutes China couple's claims on husband's whereabouts
item.description:
August 20, 2020 12:21 AM

SINGAPORE - The information provided by a couple from China to official contact tracers about their whereabouts was refuted by witnesses testifying for the prosecution on Wednesday (Aug 19).
